title: Fractured Time
description: A temporal physics experiment goes catastrophically wrong, fracturing a father's consciousness across multiple timelines as he searches for his lost son.

act1.title: The Experiment
act1.description: Introduction to Alexander's temporal research and the fateful experiment
key_events: Leo's unexpected entry into the lab

act2.title: The Search
act2.description: Alexander's desperate attempts to find Leo across timelines

act3.title: The Breakdown
act3.description: Alexander's consciousness fragments under the weight of grief and guilt

act4.title: The Debug
act4.description: Player intervention to help Alexander debug his consciousness

debugging_scenarios.title: Critical Memory Leak
debugging_scenarios.description: Grief_Manager.exe is consuming excessive memory, threatening system stability

debugging_scenarios.title: Infinite Search Protocol
debugging_scenarios.description: Search_Protocol.exe is stuck in an infinite loop, consuming CPU resources

debugging_scenarios.title: Thread Starvation Crisis
debugging_scenarios.description: Relationship processing threads are starved of resources, threatening important connections
success_criteria: Allocate sufficient resources to relationship threads
Maintain work relationships with Evelyn and Marcus

debugging_scenarios.title: Temporal Synchronization Error
debugging_scenarios.description: Temporal_Sync.dll is malfunctioning, causing reality perception issues

grief.description: The overwhelming loss of a child manifests as memory leaks and recursive processing loops
grief.technical_metaphor: Memory leak in emotional processing system
grief.debugging_approach: Implement grief processing limits and healthy memory management

guilt.description: Self-blame over the accident creates protected memory regions and access violations
guilt.technical_metaphor: Segmentation faults when accessing guilt-related memories
guilt.debugging_approach: Careful memory access protocols and gradual exposure therapy

hope.description: Desperate hope for Leo's return drives infinite search loops and resource exhaustion
hope.debugging_approach: Implement timeout mechanisms while preserving core hope functionality

isolation.description: Withdrawal from relationships causes thread starvation and communication errors
isolation.technical_metaphor: Thread starvation in relationship processing systems
isolation.debugging_approach: Resource reallocation and priority adjustment for social connections

technical_concepts.consciousness_as_os: The human mind operates like a computer operating system with processes, memory, and resources
technical_concepts.emotional_memory_management: Emotions are stored in memory blocks that can leak, fragment, or become corrupted
technical_concepts.parallel_processing: Multiple thoughts and emotions run simultaneously as threads and processes
technical_concepts.system_errors: Psychological issues manifest as system errors that can be debugged and fixed
technical_concepts.resource_allocation: Mental resources like attention and energy must be carefully managed and balanced
